Articles.Content:
I have played KSP for over 450 hours now, and I need ideas.

My space Program, The United Kingdom Of Kerbin Space Agency, has over 25 flights in progress, all replicas of real life satellite programmes. I want you guys to suggest ideas for more satellites that aren't incredibly difficult to replicate.

Craft Files!

I have now released the craft files for selected satellites!

Spaceport page:http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/satellite-craft-file-pack/

Here's some screenshots of...

The network around Kerbin:

ST-1:

Moho MESSENGER:

Duna Reconaissance Orbiter:

Hot Bird-1D:

(P.S mods please move this if this is in the wrong place, I saw the phrase "tell us about your missions" so...yeah)

Edited September 1, 2013 by scorchdestroya
Typo
Well, you are using mods, which makes it a whole lot easier to replicate real-world craft. No offense.

Well, you are using mods, which makes it a whole lot easier to replicate real-world craft. No offense.

None taken! Anyway replicas of real-world craft are close to impossible with the tiny probe parts of the stock game. BTW here's all the launch vehicles I have at my disposal using said mods:

Atlas-V (All variants + Dual Engine Centaur)

Atlas A-H(+centaur)

Ariane 4

Ariane 5

H-IIA

Europa

Vega

Falcon-1

Falcon-9 (all variants)

Falcon-Heavy

Most of the Titan launchers

Saturn V (I know, it only launched apollo and skylab)

Saturn-1B ( I know, apollo only)

Some domestically developed launchers, mostly KW rockets.

Edited October 3, 2013 by scorchdestroya
Added some more launch vehicles.
How about the LRO/LCROSS Shepherding sats?

If you really want a challenge, try to replicate the TanDEM X Mission of the german aerospace center

These are two identical satellites flying in a helix formation with currently just 150 meters between them.

Both of them have to go over the poles, so while flying parallel at the equator, they fly on top of each other over the poles. Because the altitude for the satellite above is just a bit higher, it's a bit slower and is overtaken by the lower one. If watched from the side, it would look like they fly in circels around eachother.

For more information (and videos) you can google for TanDEM X, TerraSAR X and of course DLR (Deutsche Luft- & Raumfahrt, which is the German Aerospace Center)
I had the LCROSS progamme up back in 0.20.2. The update got rid of them as well as the Landsat programme.
I might want to try that, but I'll have to substitute the Dnepr rockets with something else. Maybe an Athena...
You should try to replicate the GRAIL mission

Edited August 24, 2013 by scorchdestroya
I like the old launchers
Hmmmm. I'll see what I can do. If I succeed, would you like the craft file?

My suggestions would be:

* The Voyager probes (they're the iconic satelites!)

* Hayabusa

* Kaguya/SELENE

* New Horizons

My suggestions would be:

* The Voyager probes (they're the iconic satelites!)

* Hayabusa

* Kaguya/SELENE

* New Horizons

Voyager is coming up, along with the Titan-IIIC. On Hayabusa, Dres or Eeloo? New horizons is terrifyingly difficult to recreate because of it's piano shape. i might try SELENE after some research.

Edited August 23, 2013 by scorchdestroya
Another typo...

Voyager & It's Titan IIIC in the VAB:

The Golden Record:

I am now working on a new mission!

This one is the Venus (Eve) Express orbiter. This mission is perfect because it uses a launcher that I already posess, the Soyuz-FG/Fregat. As part of a build up set of missions that I like to do before sending orbiters, I am also sending a replica of the pioneer Venus orbiter and the magellan orbiter.

Here's the Eve Express orbiter:

Here's the Pioneer:

Here's the Magellan:

Edited August 24, 2013 by scorchdestroya
It is possible to recreate some probes with stock parts, if you use the QBE.

It is possible to recreate some probes with stock parts, if you use the QBE.

If you look at the pic above of magellan, it looks like it'll be made with 2 QBEs, 1 Flat OCTO, and an octagonal strut.

Have you thought about recreating any of the Venera or Vega missions? (Though I'm not sure the balloons would work correctly, the way atmospherics, craft interactions, and loading distances work in this game.)

Have you thought about recreating any of the Venera or Vega missions? (Though I'm not sure the balloons would work correctly, the way atmospherics, craft interactions, and loading distances work in this game.)

Venera...Maybe, although I will not be accurate and I won't shut it down after 90 minutes because of failure.

Vega...Maybe when a mod to supply some much needed parts comes around.
Can you post .crafts when your done with this round?
Ok, i will post the craft files for any requested satellites
Just got back from the national space centre in Leicester by the way. The Soyuz was waaaaay bigger than I thought it would be. same story with Columbus.
The DRO,ST-1 and the Hot Bird-D1
